title: go fmt behaviour inconsistent with help message
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
If possible, include a link to a program on play.golang.org.
1. Have a small command line go program spread over two+ files in a folder.
2. Execute 'go run' in the folder.

What is the expected output?
It should compile & run all non-test go-files in the folder, as described in 'go
help run'

Other go commands (build, vet, fmt &c) works like this on these source files, so I
would expect 'go run' to do the same.

What do you see instead?
Error message 'go run: no go files listed'

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
6g

Which operating system are you using?
OS X (most recent version as per May 2013)

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.1 darwin/amd64
